#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=News crew kidnapped and tortured by slum ' militia ' in Brazil
#Text=Sunday , June 1 , 2008

#Text=A crew of three news workers was kidnapped and tortured by members of a criminal organization self-labeled as a militia in a favela ( Brazilian slum ) in Rio de Janeiro , local daily O Dia reported this Sunday .

#Text=A reporter , a photographer and a driver - all employed by the newspaper - were working undercover on a story about the rule of such groups in a poor community known as Batan , in the western area of Rio , when they were found out by the criminals and kept captive for seven and a half hours .
#Text=According to the newspaper , all three were subjected to electric shock , asphyxiated with plastic bags , and beaten several times .
#Text=The next morning , they were released by their captors under threat of death if made any denunciations .
#Text=Prior to that , however , the reporter managed to send text and photos to the newsroom , by email from a wireless computer .
#Text=The kidnapping and torture happened May 14 to 15 , but the news organization decided to postpone its printing for safety reasons .
#Text=The heads of police and public security in the state government , however , had been immediately informed .
#Text=The story was only printed today , as the denounce came to public , after officials assured the primary investigations had begun and those held responsible were already identified .
#Text=The identities and whereabouts of the news workers are being kept secret .
#Text=According to the story as it was printed , the kidnappers insisted they were not criminals , but policemen who were acting " ahead of justice " .
#Text=They are said to govern the community under a " reign of terror " , by imposing curfews , banning funk parties , and charging dwellers and small business for " protection " .

#Text=At the moment when journalists are doing their job in a favela , to take information to society , and they are brutally tortured , it puts democracy under jeopardy . — José Carlos Torves , National Federation of Journalists

#Text=The same militiamen also have a scheme to elect politicians committed with them , by making lists of voters who live in each favela , with name and electoral registry number for each one , and barring other candidates from campaigning within the neighborhood .
#Text=Connection with Christian ( Neo-Pentecostalist ) churches were also cited .
#Text=The case brought calls for defense on press freedom and safety for reporters by journalists and civil rights entities in Brazil .
#Text="

#Text=For the Brazilian Press Association ( ABI ) , besides the uncomfortable solidarity we think we must offer to these fellows , there is also the need to claim from authorities , from the State , the strict investigation of such facts  , demanded the chairman of such entity , Maurício Azêdo .
